shows.title: Skinwalker Ranch / Hunting Astronomical Anomalies
shows.first_half: First Half: Guest host George Knapp welcomes venture capitalist Brandon Fugal to discuss his ongoing investigation at Skinwalker Ranch, plus the upcoming new season of his hit docuseries on the History Channel. Skinwalker Ranch is the most scientifically studied paranormal hotspot in the world.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Chief photo and video analyst for MUFON, Marc D'Antonio, will discuss his creation of SkyTour LiveStream, an organization that remotely operates observatories in Arizona from Connecticut. These telescopes sometimes show anomalies in the night sky.

shows.title: Understanding Addiction / Plant Spirit Healing
shows.first_half: First Half: Self-help author Faust Ruggiero will help us to understand the various types of addiction, as well as what both addicts and their family members can do to help address their problems. He'll focus on explaining what exactly causes people to become anxious and depressed.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Shamanic teacher and plant spirit healer Emma Fitchett will bring us her work in plant spirit healing and how it connects to working through psychic spaces. She'll also describe how the spirit world assists people in their spiritual evolution.

shows.title: Natural Remedies / Induced After-Death Communication
shows.first_half: First Half: Pharmacist Ben Fuchs will discuss natural health remedies and the vitamins, nutrients, and minerals that our bodies need to maintain good health. Fuchs is a registered pharmacist, nutritionist, and cosmetic chemist who is recognized nationally for his work as a host on the The Bright Side radio program.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Award-winning clinical psychologist Dr. Tom Nehmy will explain Induced After-Death Communication (IADC) therapy. He'll share his professional journey, from being a therapist who felt helpless in the face of grief to profoundly helping people with their own loss.

shows.title: Mars & the Kessler Effect / The Haunted Housewives
shows.guests: Christopher Lee Jones, Theresa Argie, Cathi Weber
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and retired firefighter Christopher Lee Jones will discuss all things Mars, as well as the Kessler Effect—the accumulation of space debris in low-earth orbit—along with its implications and how we can survive it.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Theresa Argie and Cathi Weber, aka The Haunted Housewives, will explain paranormal influences and how history and hauntings go hand-in-hand. The Housewives will specifically show us how ghost hunting and interest in paranormal research have saved historic venues, museums, and other important sites.

shows.title: The Toll of Warfare / The Chemtrails Agenda
shows.guests: Joseph Soel, Cheryll Jones, Elana Freeland
shows.first_half: First Half: Joe Soel, an author who served in the Iraq War, will discuss his journey from combat veteran to veteran writer. He'll explore the deep emotional and moral toll of modern warfare, and explain how his experiences have changed the course of his life.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Coast to Coast's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones will play and discuss her interview with scientific researcher Elana Freeland about the dark agenda of chemtrails.

shows.title: Legacy of The Beatles / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Author Mark Brake will discuss how The Beatles became the most influential band of all time. He'll present facts, fiction, and commentary about this beloved group of musicians. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half.
